The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7.

The tree has 13 nodes, and the root node is s. The height of the root node is the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node.

From the root node s, we can follow these edges to reach a leaf node: s->t, t->z, z->ab, z->bb, z->cb, z->db, t->eb, eb->fb, eb->gb, eb->hb, eb->ib, jc->pc, pc->qc, pc->rc, pc->sc, pc->tc.

So the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7 edges long.

Note: This tree is represented as a binary tree where each node has a left child and a right child. The height of a binary tree is equal to the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node. The height of a leaf node is 0.
